page.title: 17PALLINGHAM MANOR FARM
page.content: This 450 acre farm is the only part of the area in the parish of Wisborough Green. Half the land is arable, growing winter wheat and barley; and half is used for rearing a beef herd of Friesian cattle with a few Hereford and Angus breeds. The oldest building, Chapel Barn, is 12th century and is scheduled as an ancient monument. It is believed to be part of the original residence. The present farmhouse is 16th century and includes "Pulborough" and "Washington" stone. The farmhouse and many of the late 18th century wooden barns are listed as buildings of national importance. Over the last 14 years, the owners have carried out careful restoration of house,barns and outbuildings. This restoration earned them the West Sussex C.C. Conservation Award in 1978
